questions.question: Which motor is commonly used for precise control of angular position in Arduino projects?

explanations.a: DC Motors are typically used for continuous rotation, not for precise angular positioning.
explanations.b: Servo motors are designed specifically for precise control of angular position and are commonly used in Arduino projects.
explanations.c: Stepper motors offer precise stepwise movement, but servo motors are better suited for angular position control.
explanations.d: Brushless DC motors are more efficient but require complex control mechanisms, unlike servo motors.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a motor driver like L298N with DC motors in Arduino projects?

answers.a: To increase the voltage supplied to the motor.
answers.b: To control the speed and direction of the motor.
answers.c: To reduce the power consumption of the motor.
answers.d: To amplify the PWM signal for faster motor operation.

explanations.a: Motor drivers like L298N are not used to increase the voltage; they are used to control the motor's direction and speed.
explanations.b: L298N allows you to control both the direction and speed of a DC motor by using digital signals and PWM.
explanations.c: Motor drivers like L298N don't reduce the power consumption but rather regulate the motor's operation.
explanations.d: Motor drivers like L298N are designed to control the motor's direction and speed, not specifically to amplify the PWM signal.

questions.question: Which motor is ideal for applications requiring precise stepwise rotation, such as in CNC machines or 3D printers?

explanations.a: DC motors do not provide precise stepwise rotation and are generally used for continuous motion.
explanations.b: Servo motors are good for angular positioning but do not offer stepwise rotation like stepper motors.
explanations.c: Stepper motors are ideal for precise stepwise rotation and are commonly used in applications like CNC machines and 3D printers.
explanations.d: Brushless DC motors are more efficient but not suitable for stepwise movement like stepper motors.

questions.question: In Arduino, how is the direction of a DC motor typically controlled?

answers.a: By controlling the PWM signal on the motor pin.
answers.b: By switching the motor's power supply.
answers.c: By using an H-Bridge or motor driver like L298N.

explanations.a: PWM controls the speed of the motor, not the direction.
explanations.b: Switching the power supply doesn't reliably control the direction of the motor.
explanations.c: The direction of a DC motor is controlled by switching the input pins of an H-Bridge or motor driver like L298N.
explanations.d: Servo motors are used for angular positioning, not for controlling DC motor direction.
